Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8

I think posting it to YouTube would work fine. As for comments, it's really=
 just what you think would make a better video. It's not necessary, but fee=
l free to do it for the benefit of anyone watching who just wants to check =
out the game. Thanks for your help!
Paul

      From: "Brian Ciesicki tripl=
etopper@... [ballyalley]" <ballyalley@yahoogroups.com>
 To: bally=
alley@yahoogroups.com 
 Sent: Monday, November 21, 2016 7:15 PM
 Subject: R=
e: [ballyalley] Astrocade Rentals and Jack Nieman; was: High Score Club, Ro=
und 13 - Blast Droids and Haunted House
   
=C2=A0   Actually I don=E2=80=
=99t have a copy of the retail release, so I don=E2=80=99t know the differe=
nces, so I=E2=80=99ll play 15 minutes of the game, and you see if you notic=
e any differences. =C2=A0 I don=E2=80=99t know whether I should commentate =
the control scheme and other feel throughs, or whether I should let the gam=
es sounds speak for themselves. =C2=A0I would twitch it, except for 3 facto=
rs, 1) I don=E2=80=99t have much bandwidth, for a 480i outbound video, even=
 if I use all 400 k out, 2) My xbox won=E2=80=99t let me twitch out through=
 the HDMI IN port, and 3) the computer is very far away from the CRT TV and=
 is a Macintosh, and I don=E2=80=99t know how to twitch out with a Macintos=
h and a Hauppauge Rocket.
Some advice about how to share this?

On Nov 21, =
2016, at 3:22 PM, Paul Thacker lennier_of_the_minbari@... [ballyalley=
] <ballyalley@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
Neat! That could be a prototype. Can =
you tell if it's any different than the retail release?
Paul

Sent from Yah=
oo Mail on Android

=C2=A0Brian Ciesicki wrote:
>>
It was a local chain in =
the east-side suburbs of Cleveland known as Captain Video. =C2=A0[...] That=
 was the first time I was exposed to the Astrocade.
>>

I loved your descri=
ption of how you first approached the Astrocade's controller!

>>
Also one =
of my cartridges looks like a sample cartridge wth a message saying sample =
belongs to Jack Nieman. =C2=A0Is Jack Nieman involved in any way with Bally=
/Astrocade?
>>

Wow, very cool! Jack Nieman was Bally's national sales mana=
ger in the 1970s. Paul and I have mentioned him a few times on recent episo=
des of the Astrocast podcast because Jack was often named in people's lette=
rs to the Arcadian (and in the Arcadian itself).

I just did a search of th=
e Bob Fabris Collection. I have a short note to Bob from Jack from Septembe=
r 1978. I also have a letter that Bob wrote to Jack in 1980.

Adam

971856137class">Also one of my cartridges looks like a sample cartridge wth=

ved in any way with Bally/Astrocade?<br clear=3D"none" class=3D"yiv29718561=
37class">>><br clear=3D"none" class=3D"yiv2971856137class"><br clear=
=3D"none" class=3D"yiv2971856137class">Wow, very cool! Jack Nieman was Ball=
y's national sales manager in the 1970s. Paul and I have mentioned him a fe=
w times on recent episodes of the Astrocast podcast because Jack was often =
named in people's letters to the Arcadian (and in the Arcadian itself).<br =
clear=3D"none" class=3D"yiv2971856137class"><br clear=3D"none" class=3D"yiv=
2971856137class">I just did a search of the Bob Fabris Collection. I have a=
 short note to Bob from Jack from September 1978. I also have a letter that=
 Bob wrote to Jack in 1980.<br clear=3D"none" class=3D"yiv2971856137class">=
<br clear=3D"none" class=3D"yiv2971856137class">Adam</div></div><div class=
